Sure, here are some tips for making new friends and getting involved on campus at the University of Virginia:

1. Attend Campus Events - Attend new student orientation events, grab a coffee with a classmate or sign up for clubs that interest you. This can ease you into the social scene and open doors for new friendship circles. 2. Join Clubs and Organizations - UVA has over 750 student organizations to choose from, including sports, hobbies and interests, politics and social causes, pre-professional and Greek life. 3. Participate in Recreational Sports - Participating in sport can be an excellent way to meet new people, improve your fitness and join a sense of community. 4. Get a Part-Time Job - A part-time job can be an excellent opportunity to meet new people and maintain financial stability

5. Volunteer - UVA has a strong emphasis on community service and social engagement. Consider participating in volunteering projects with other students. 6. Attend Student Group Meetings - Many groups have weekly or bimonthly meetings, where members connect and discuss current events in their field of interest. This is an excellent way to meet likeminded individuals. 7. Attend Campus Concerts and Shows - The student run music organization, UPC, regularly hosts concerts and shows on grounds. This can be a great way to connect with a diverse group of students and experience new forms of art. 8. Keep an open mind and step out of your comfort zone - College is an excellent time to experiment and try new things. Before you know it, you will establish deep and meaningful friendships with your fellow students. These are just a few tips for making new friends and getting involved on campus. The key is to be outgoing, open to new experiences, and willing to put yourself out there. Good luck and have fun!
